column3: Risks
column4: Description
column5: Countermeasure

column2: Team building and getting to know each other
column3: Lack of team cohesion
column4: Insufficient team bonding may lead to communication breakdowns and conflicts, hindering effective collaboration.
column5: Conduct team-building activities early on

column3: Misalignment of skills and responsibilities
column4: Inadequate alignment of team members' skills with roles may result in inefficiencies and hinder task completion.
column5: Clearly define roles and responsibilities

column2: Agreement on a common working method
column3: Differences in work preferences and styles
column4: Divergent work preferences and styles may impede collaboration, affecting overall efficiency and work quality.
column5: Establish a team agreement for working methods

column3: Incomplete understanding of the project scope
column4: Team members not fully comprehending the project scope may lead to incorrect assumptions and incomplete work.
column5: Conduct thorough project briefings and training

column3: Difficulty in scheduling and coordinating meetings
column4: Challenges in scheduling meetings with the client may cause delays in gathering essential project requirements.
column5: Use scheduling tools and establish clear communication

column3: Coach availability and communication challenges
column4: Challenges in coach availability and communication may hinder guidance and support for the team.
column5: Establish a communication schedule with the coach

column2: Development and finalization of the vision
column3: Lack of clarity in the project vision
column4: Insufficient clarity in the project vision may lead to misunderstandings and divergent expectations.
column5: Conduct thorough discussions to clarify the project vision

column2: Creation of a rough graphic prototype
column3: Technical challenges in creating the prototype
column4: Technical difficulties in creating the prototype may lead to delays and impact the demonstration of key functionalities.
column5: Conduct a feasibility analysis for the chosen technology

column3: Limited understanding of Github among team members
column4: Limited understanding of Github may hinder effective collaboration.
column5: Provide Github tutorials and training sessions

column2: Creation of the use case model
column3: Ambiguity in use-case requirements
column4: Ambiguous use-case requirements may lead to misunderstandings and result in an inadequate use-case model.
column5: Collaborate closely with stakeholders for clear requirements

column3: Lack of detailed information for UC01
column4: Insufficient detailed information for UC01 may lead to incomplete work and potential misalignment with stakeholder expectations.
column5: Schedule sessions with domain experts for information gathering

column3: Misinterpretation of UC03 requirements
column4: Misinterpretation of UC03 requirements may lead to incorrect use-case specifications and impact the overall project.
column5: Establish regular communication channels with stakeholders

column2: Further education for all with Github
column3: Resistance to adopting Github as a collaboration tool
column4: Resistance to Github adoption may hinder effective collaboration and version control.
column5: Communicate the benefits of Github for collaboration and version control

column3: Limited collaboration and understanding between developers and testers
column4: Limited collaboration and understanding between developers and testers may result in inefficient testing processes.
column5: Organize joint training sessions for developers and testers

column3: Overlooking potential project risks
column4: Failure to identify potential risks may lead to inadequate risk management and project disruptions.
column5: Engage the entire team in a collaborative risk identification session

column3: Errors in frontend development
column4: Issues in frontend development may lead to a suboptimal user interface and user experience.
column5: Have a backup plan with alternative frontend frameworks or approaches

column3: Errors in backend development
column4: Issues in backend development may lead to system instability and performance issues.
column5: Have a rollback plan and alternative backend solutions

column3: Unexpected departure of a team member
column4: A team member leaving the team unexpectedly can disrupt the workflow and impact project knowledge and expertise.
column5: Cross-train team members to mitigate the impact

column2: The role of the analyst must be taken on
column3: Elimination analysts in the 2nd semester
column4: Due to the fact that the industrial engineers are only at SE1, our last analyst at the moment will be omitted.
column5: A team member must be entrusted with the analyst's tasks
